{{cpp/ranges/view_interface/title|cbegin}}
{{cpp/ranges/view_interface/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++23|
constexpr auto cbegin();
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++23|
constexpr auto cbegin() const requires ranges::range&lt;const D&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The default implementation of {{tt|cbegin()}} member function returns a constant beginning iterator of the range.

{{image|range-begin-end.svg}}

@1@ Let {{c|derived}} be a reference bound to {{c|static_cast&lt;D&amp;&gt;(*this)}}.
@@ Equivalent to {{c|return ranges::cbegin(derived);}}.

@2@ Same as {{v|1}}, except that {{c|derived}} is {{c|static_cast&lt;const D&amp;&gt;(*this)}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A constant beginning iterator of the range.

===Notes===
All range adaptors and range factories in the standard library and {{lc|std::ranges::subrange}} use the default implementation of {{tt|cbegin}}.
